w:r.w:t: According to the Charlesâ€™s law, if the pressure of the ideal gas is kept constant, its volume is directly proportional to the temperature of the ideal gas.

Since the pressure of the ideal gas is constant, therefore the volume of the gas is directly proportional to its temperature. Therefore, volume of the ideal gas increases with increase in temperature.
